section.title: lms.djangoapps.program_enrollments.management.commands.expire_waiting_enrollments module
section.paragraph: Management command to cleanup old waiting enrollments

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: BaseCommand
Deletes enrollments not tied to a user that have not been modified for at least 60 days.
Entry point for subclassed commands to add custom arguments.
The actual logic of the command. Subclasses must implement this method.

desc_signature.desc_annotation: = 'Remove expired enrollments that have not been linked to a user.'

section.title: lms.djangoapps.program_enrollments.management.commands.link_program_enrollments module
section.paragraph: Management command to link program enrollments and external student_keys to an LMS user

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: BaseCommand
Management command to manually link ProgramEnrollments without an LMS user to an LMS user by username.

definition.paragraph: ./manage.py lms link_program_enrollments <program_uuid> <user_item>* where a <user_item> is a string formatted as <external_user_key>:<lms_username>

desc_content.paragraph: Normally, program enrollments should be linked by the Django Social Auth post_save signal handler lms.djangoapps.program_enrollments.signals.matriculate_learner, but in the case that a partner does not have an IDP set up for learners to log in through, we need a way to link enrollments.

Provided a program uuid and a list of external_user_key:lms_username, this command will look up the matching program enrollments and users, and update the program enrollments with the matching user. If the program enrollment has course enrollments, we will enroll the user into their waiting program courses.
If an external user key is specified twice, an exception will be raised and no enrollments will be modified.

list_item.paragraph: No enrollment is found for the given program and external_user_key
The enrollment already has a user

desc_content.paragraph: An error message will be logged and the input will be skipped. All other inputs will be processed and enrollments updated.

If there is an error while enrolling a user in a waiting program course enrollment, the error will be logged, and we will roll back all transactions for that user so that their db state will be the same as it was before this command was run. This is to allow the re-running of the same command again to correctly enroll the user once the issue preventing the enrollment has been resolved.
No other users will be affected, they will be processed normally.
Entry point for subclassed commands to add custom arguments.
The actual logic of the command. Subclasses must implement this method.

desc_signature.desc_annotation: = 'Manually links ProgramEnrollment records to LMS users'

definition.paragraph: list of strings in the format ‘external_user_key:lms_username’

field_body.paragraph: dict mapping external user keys to lms usernames

section.title: lms.djangoapps.program_enrollments.management.commands.migrate_saml_uids module
section.paragraph: Management command to re-write UIDs identifying learners in external organizations’ systems
Intented for use in production environments, to help support migration of existing SSO learners into our most-recent program enrollment flow without needing to manually re-link their account.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: BaseCommand
Updates UserSocialAuth records to use UIDs provided in the supplied JSON file
Entry point for subclassed commands to add custom arguments.
Performs the re-writing

desc_signature.desc_annotation:
= 'Updates UserSocialAuth records to use UIDs provided in the supplied JSON file

Example usage:
 $ ./manage.py lms migrate_saml_uids.py --uid-mapping=path/to/file.json
 --saml-provider-slug=default'

section.title: lms.djangoapps.program_enrollments.management.commands.reset_enrollment_data module
section.paragraph: Management command to remove enrollments and any related models created as a side effect of enrolling students.
Intented for use in integration sandbox environments

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: BaseCommand
Deletes all enrollments and related data
Entry point for subclassed commands to add custom arguments.
The actual logic of the command. Subclasses must implement this method.

desc_signature.desc_annotation:
= 'Deletes all enrollments and related data

Example usage:
 $ ./manage.py lms reset_enrollment_data ca73b4af-676a-4bb3-a9a5-f6b5a3dedd,1c5f61b9-0be5-4a90-9ea5-582d5e066c'

section.title: lms.djangoapps.program_enrollments.management.commands.send_program_course_nudge_email module
section.paragraph: Django management command for sending nudge emails to learners after they complete once course in a program, to suggest to complete possible next course from same program.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: BaseCommand
Django management command for sending nudge emails to learners

This command sends nudge emails to complete next course to learners after they complete a course that is linked with one or multiple programs. if next course in the program is already in progress, command skips that program and try to propose course for next linked program.
Entry point to add arguments.
Emit the Segment event which will be used by Braze to send the email
get detailed program.
Get program in a new format containing candidate_courses and in_progress_courses_ids
Get all programs with candidate courses.
get course run from a program.
Finds out enrollable course run from programs Generated by ProgramProgressMeter.
Returns: Suggested program and course_run dicts
Returns mapping between course passed yesterday with passing users.
Command’s entry point.
Sorts programs based on their revenue ranking.
Check if a course run is in enrollable state.
